description:
The V2 API returns 404 is an attempt is made to call an extension which is not enabled.

501 would be a more appropriate error code
title: Nova V3 APi should return 501 (Not implemented) for missing extensions

comments.content:
The V2 API returns 404 is an attempt is made to call an extension which is not enabled.

501 would be a more appropriate error code
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~philip-day

comments.content: 404 (not found) seems wrong for an extension that is disabled, since it exists but it just isn't usable.  Not implemented doesn't seem right to me either though, since if the extension exists but isn't enabled, it's definitely implemented.  It seems like trying to use a disabled extension is more of a 409 to me.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Do you have a specific example for this?

In general if the extension is not enabled, its not loaded and so the resource path is never added. That's why there is a 404. I'm not sure it'd be worth the effort trying to load something that someone doesn't want loaded just to work out where a resource path would have existed just so we can return a 409 (which I'm not sure is really better).
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cyeoh-0
